meanings.sent1: The tendinous tissue connected the muscle to the bone.
meanings.sent2: Her tendinous ankle was sore after the long run.
meanings.sent3: The tendinous connection between the two characters in the story made for an interesting plot twist.
meanings.sent4: His tendinous grip on reality seemed to slip as he delved deeper into his imagination.
meanings.sent5: The tendinous fibers were as strong as steel, holding everything together.

meanings.sent1: The tendinous texture of the fabric made it durable for outdoor use.
meanings.sent2: The tendinous structure of the bridge provided great support.
meanings.sent3: The tendinous appearance of the clouds in the sky reminded her of cotton candy.
meanings.sent4: His tendinous voice echoed through the empty hall, sending shivers down her spine.
meanings.sent5: The tendinous design of the sculpture captured the essence of strength and flexibility.
